title: Biden Administration Altered Rules for Sharing Intelligence With Ukraine
sub_head: After lawmakers expressed concerns about how much information was being provided to Kyiv, the White House modified its guidance to Pentagon, spy agencies
body:
WASHINGTON—The White House last week modified existing guidance for the Pentagon and U.S. spy agencies on sending intelligence data to the Ukrainian government to clear the way of any bureaucratic roadblocks to information sharing, a senior Biden administration official said.
That change followed complaints from both Democratic and Republican lawmakers that President Biden’s administration wasn’t sharing real-time targeting data that would enable Ukraine’s military to strike back at Russian armored formations bombarding and attempting to envelop its major cities.
